description: Application to clear condition 5 (basement impact assessment) of approved application DM2024/01694.
decision_conditions: Prior to the commencement of development, a finalised Basement Impact Assessment (BIA) carried out by an appropriately qualified professional must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing. The finalised BIA must include:(i) evidence, based on on-site geotechnical and environmental survey work and detailed design work, to demonstrate that the proposed basement area will not affect existing surface-water flow routes or increase risk of flooding for either the donor dwelling or adjacent buildings and structures;(ii) details of structural waterproofing arrangements and proposed design specifications in order to ensure effective water retention below ground-level;(iii) details of the proposed foundation solution / construction method;(iv) arrangements for dewatering the excavation during construction in order to deal with potential groundwater seepage and superficial runoff during rainfall events;(v) confirmation that the basement will be waterproofed to Grade 3 (BS 8102) to protect against ingress of soil moisture and perched groundwater(vi) details of all proposed SuDS measures including the proposed external permeable paving area in order to to manage surface water run-off from the site in line with the Mayor's drainage hierarchy.Reason: To comply with Policy 32 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.
